text: this passageway near Times Square
connects 12 train lines in the busiest
subway station in New York it's right
around here that yet a law set off a
homemade pipe bomb security cameras
caught the explosion on tape the tunnel
opened in 1932 part of New York's
efforts to create a municipal subway
line to compete with private companies
it's almost a block long around 600 feet
it takes about two minutes to walk from
one side to the other from the train
lines at the station it's easy to reach
three major transit hubs so at rush hour
low tunnel gets crowded packed at its
worst with kindred with surly travelers
everyone just trying to get to the other
side sparse but by exposed fluorescent
tubes beige paint and white tiles
dominate with iPhone ads and the odd
mosaic for color
when it rains or during the cold winter
it's a refuge place to watch people from
all walks of life on Monday
I'd also became a target but just a day
after the attack New Yorkers were once
again streaming to this passageway
